messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Knutsen reprint
messages.msgSnippet:
If I could also add, a reference to Roald Knutsen other new book 
Rediscovering Budo from a Swordsmans Perspective  - although less on
weaponry information
messages.messageBody:
If I could also add, a reference to Roald Knutsen other "new" book "
Rediscovering Budo from a Swordsmans Perspective" - although less on
weaponry information as is his Japanese Spears & Polearms - ... it is a
wonderful read and a great reference book on the roots/history and tradition
of Bujutsu & Budo from a person with a wealth of hands-on experience in
Japan of the swordsmans & warrior culture.
with Bibliography, Glossary & Notes

ISBN 1-901903-61-3
Published 2004 - Global Oriental

Rick

-------Original Message-------

From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Date: 01/18/05 12:23:00
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Knutsen reprint

Someone was asking about when the reprint of Knutsen's book on polearms
would be available. I just got the below in an email from Paragon. Amazon
s price is the same.

Knutsen, Roald & Knutsen, Patricia: JAPANESE SPEARS: POLEARMS AND THEIR USE
IN OLD JAPAN 7 x 9.75", xxvi, 131 pp., 16 b/w plates, 64 pages of b/w
figures, glossary, bibliography, index, cloth, d.j., Kent, 2004.
This fully illustrated study of naginata and yari, the only reference of its
kind in English, records the many variations of spear design from the
ancient period when warrior chieftains settled in Japan from the Asian
mainland, down to the fall of the Tokugawa in 1868 that marked the close of
the feudal period. In addition, it offers the reader valuable insight into
the historical attitude of the Japanese warrior to warfare and examples of
how these often splendid weapons in the bujutsu - the arts of the
battlefield. Item # 30321 ISBN 1901903567 (Global Oriental) Price: $50.00
http://www.paragonbook.com/html/browsesubj/fullcitation.cfm?item=30321

Jim

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Someone was asking about when the reprint of Knutsen's book on polearms would be available. I just got the below in an email from Paragon. Amazon's price is the same.

Knutsen, Roald & Knutsen, Patricia: JAPANESE SPEARS: POLEARMS AND THEIR USE IN OLD JAPAN 7 x 9.75", xxvi, 131 pp., 16 b/w plates, 64 pages of b/w figures, glossary, bibliography, index, cloth, d.j., Kent, 2004.
This fully illustrated study of naginata and yari, the only reference of its kind in English, records the many variations of spear design from the ancient period when warrior chieftains settled in Japan from the Asian mainland, down to the fall of the Tokugawa in 1868 that marked the close of the feudal period. In addition, it offers the reader valuable insight into the historical attitude of the Japanese warrior to warfare and examples of how these often splendid weapons in the bujutsu - the arts of the battlefield. Item # 30321 ISBN 1901903567 (Global Oriental) Price: $50.00
http://www.paragonbook.com/html/browsesubj/fullcitation.cfm?item=30321

Jim
